Name: Renaming a park in the Borough of Queens, Archie Spigner Park, and to amend the official map of the city of New York accordingly.
Title: A Local Law in relation to renaming a park in the Borough of Queens, Archie Spigner Park, and to amend the official map of the city of New York accordingly

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was Returned Unsigned by Mayor
This Introduction was City Charter Rule Adopted

Attachments.Name: November 23, 2021 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
December 15, 2021 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - November 23, 2021

Summary: This bill would rename “St. Albans Park” in Queens to "Archie Spigner Park.”
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1. The following park name, in the Borough of Queens, is hereby renamed as hereafter indicated.

New Name
Present Name
Limits
Archie Spigner Park
St. Albans Park
An existing park area generally bounded by 169 Street, Sayres Avenue,  Linden Boulevard, Marne Place, 111 Road and 172 Street 

      �2. The official map of the city of New York shall be amended in accordance with the provisions of section one of this local law.
	�3. This local law shall take effect immediately.




KS
LS # 17869
11/17/21
